textbooks.title: Business Intelligence, Analytics, and Data Science: A Managerial Perspective

topics: Tableau - Exploring & analyzing data part I
Tableau - Exploring & analyzing data part II

grading.policies: This grading scheme is subject to change based on student outcomes. It may be curved more leniently. It will not be made more difficult.

policies.attendance: You are expected to attend all classes. Devices may be used in class for Tableau and note taking. Please contact me in advance if there are circumstances that prevent you from attending class. I reserve the right to reduce your grade through lack of attendance.
policies.late_work: No late assignments, without prior approval, will be accepted.
policies.academic_integrity: Cheating during in-class tests or take-home examinations or homework is illegal and immoral. Consequences of academic impropriety are severe, ranging from receiving an 'F' in a course to expulsion.

additional_info.course_format: The course will employ lectures, individual homework, and a project.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Devices may be used in class for Tableau and note taking.

_metadata.course_description: Applied Analytics is intended to reinforce the understanding of analysis as a way to build models that can focus attention on parts of the system that can be improved through intervention.
learning_outcomes: Recount a set of appropriate analysis techniques when presented with a business problem
Understand how particular techniques might be used to make sense of data
Analyze a situation and traces of past behavior to recommend future actions
Apply analytic and machine learning techniques to business problems
Compare the results of different analytic techniques
Synthesize analysis performed at different levels into a policy recommendation
